subject: RE: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
msgSnippet: Well, VAJ is not that high on the JDK version, but it has (IMO) the absolute best debugger in the field. HTH. -jason ... Jason Rogers
messageBody:
Well, VAJ is not that high on the JDK version, but it has (IMO) the
absolute best debugger in the field.

HTH.
-jason

-----Original Message-----
From: Russ Baker [mailto:rbaker@...]
Sent: Thursday, November 15, 2001 3:11 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?


Hello,

I have been stuck using jBuilder to debug my code. Well, after fighting
with the IDE for months now, I have come to the conclusion that, for
lack of
better verbiage, jBuilder's (4.0) debugger is flaky. The debugger
constantly goes into code that it shouldn't, and actually forces me to
go
back to using the old System.out method of debugging, how wasteful!

Does anyone know of a decent debugger? I am currently using the
jdk1.3.1.

Thanks in advance,

Russ Baker
